essentials

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • essentials.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Various ways of safely deleting files.
    Author:
    Maximilian

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileUtils(java.io.File f) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean burn(float howLong)
      Will change random bytes to random values.
      boolean create(long length)
      Creates a file with a given length.
      boolean delete()
      Deletes a file in the normal way.
      boolean overwriteWith(byte data)
      Overwrite the file with a given byte Takes 13 seconds for one iteration over a 50MB file.
      boolean secureDelete()
      Deletes files or directories safely, by overwriting them multiple times in different ways.
      boolean shred(int times)
      Will overwrite the file with random bytes. .wipe() is probably better and more efficient, but I'm not sure if it works.
      boolean wipe(int times)
      Will overwrite the file with random bytes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileUtils

        public FileUtils(java.io.File f)

    • Method Detail

      • shred

        public boolean shred(int times)
        Will overwrite the file with random bytes. .wipe() is probably better and more efficient, but I'm not sure if it works. Takes 23 seconds for one iteration over a 50MB file.
        Parameters:
        times - Number of iterations
        Returns:
        success

      • wipe

        public boolean wipe(int times)
        Will overwrite the file with random bytes. Is probably better then .shred, but .shred works for sure, this doesn't. Takes 23 seconds for one iteration over a 50MB file.
        Parameters:
        times - Number of iterations
        Returns:
        success

      • burn

        public boolean burn(float howLong)
        Will change random bytes to random values. Really slow! Takes 20 minutes for one iteration over a 50MB file.
        Parameters:
        howLong - How long the file should burn. 1 will burn approximately half the file.
        Returns:
        success

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        Deletes a file in the normal way. Insecure! Use secureDelete()!
        Returns:
        success

      • overwriteWith

        public boolean overwriteWith(byte data)
        Overwrite the file with a given byte Takes 13 seconds for one iteration over a 50MB file.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to write in the file
        Returns:
        success *

      • secureDelete

        public boolean secureDelete()
        Deletes files or directories safely, by overwriting them multiple times in different ways. Takes 800ms per MB
        Returns:
        False if something went wrong

      • create

        public boolean create(long length)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a file with a given length. Will be filled with NULLs
        Parameters:
        length - The length in bytes of the file
        Returns:
        success
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file can't be created
